intro: Hieracium sulphureum subsp. koernickeanum, commonly known as the sulphur hawk's-beard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has finely divided, linear leaves and produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to orange ray florets. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral structure and geographic distribution.
